konaneCommon
Class BoardGrid

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--konaneCommon.BoardGrid
public class BoardGrid
extends java.lang.Object

The Konane gameboard.

The BoardGrid represents a Konane gameboard by maintaining a rectangular array of token positions, simply called "tokens" in the documentation below. Tokens may be either white (i.e. a white token occupies that position), black (i.e. a black token occupies that position), or none (i.e. the position is empty). Each of these values (white, black, and none) are called "sides" and are used to in validating and executing moves. Sides are defined as byte constants in Konane.

Version:
1.16, 17 January 2001
Author:
Paul Pham

Field Detail

height

protected int height
The height of the gameboard in columns. This number must be less than or equals to Konane.MAX_ROW.

tokens

public byte[][] tokens
Two-dimensional array of bytes representing tokens on a Konane gameboard.

width

protected int width
The width of the gameboard in columns. This number must be less than or equals to Konane.MAX_COL.
Constructor Detail

BoardGrid

public BoardGrid()
Empty default constructor. Frees subclass constructors from calling the super method.

BoardGrid

public BoardGrid(byte[][] tokens,
                 int width,
                 int height)
Constructor that accepts an array of tokens to copy, along with the width and height of the board. Used in cloning the board and in resynchronizing boards between the server and its clients. If you need to clone a board, call copy() instead.

BoardGrid

public BoardGrid(int width,
                 int height)
Constructor that accepts the width and height of the board. This constructor initializes a board to the given width and height, fills the board with alternating token values of Konane.WHITE and Konane.BLACK, and removes two initial tokens by calling removeInitialTokens(). If width is greater than Konane.MAX_COL it is truncated to the maximum allowable value. If height is greater than Konane.MAX_ROW, it is also truncated to the maximum allowable value.

getMoves

public java.util.Vector getMoves(int initialCol,
                                 int initialRow,
                                 byte side)
Returns all possible Moves from the given initial position for the given side. side should be one of the byte constants defined in Konane.
Parameters:
initialCol - column number of the initial position, numbered from 0.
initialRow - row number of the initial position, numbered from 0.
Returns:
a vector of all possible moves from the initial position for the given side.
See Also:
Konane.WHITE, Konane.BLACK

getTokenAt

public byte getTokenAt(int col,
                       int row)
Retrieves the side, or color, of a token at the given position.

First checks to see if this is a valid position in the board; if it is, returns one of three constants defined in Konane.

Parameters:
col - the column of the desired position, numbered from 0.
row - the row of the desired position, numbered from 0.
Returns:
side of the token at the given position, or Konane.ERROR if the position is invalid.
See Also:
Konane.WHITE, Konane.BLACK, Konane.NONE

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Returns the width of the board (the number of columns).

init

public void init()
Initializes the board.

Fills the grid of spaces with alternative black and white tokens, with a white token in the upper-left corner.

See Also:
Konane.WHITE, Konane.BLACK

isValidMove

public boolean isValidMove(int initialCol,
                           int initialRow,
                           int finalCol,
                           int finalRow,
                           byte side)
Determines whether the move from the given initial position to the final position for the given side on this board is valid.
Parameters:
initialCol - column number of the initial position, numbered from 0.
initialRow - row number of the initial position, numbered from 0.
finalCol - column number of the final position, numbered from 0.
finalRow - row number of the final position, numbered from 0.
Returns:
true if a valid move can be made from the initial position to the final position for the given side.

isValidMove

public boolean isValidMove(Move move)
Determines whether the move from the given initial position to the final position for the given side on this board is valid.

Decodes move into its data members and calls the previous version of isValidMove(int, int, int, int, byte).

Parameters:
initialCol - column number of the initial position, numbered from 0.
initialRow - row number of the initial position, numbered from 0.
finalCol - column number of the final position, numbered from 0.
finalRow - row number of the final position, numbered from 0.
Returns:
true if a valid move can be made from the initial position to the final position for the Move's side.

isValidPosition

public boolean isValidPosition(int col,
                               int row)
Determines whether the given position is within this board.
Parameters:
col - the column of the desired position, numbered from 0.
row - the row of the desired position, numbered from 0.
Returns:
true if the given col and row are valid positions in the board; false otherwise.

isValidSide

public static boolean isValidSide(byte side)
Determines if the given side is valid.
Parameters:
side - the side to validate.
Returns:
true if the given side is a valid side, i.e., one of the byte constants defined in Konane.
See Also:
Konane.WHITE, Konane.BLACK, Konane.NONE

makeMove

public boolean makeMove(int initialCol,
                        int initialRow,
                        int finalCol,
                        int finalRow,
                        byte side)
Executes the given move on the board.

Checks to see if the Move is valid by calling isValidMove(konaneCommon.Move). If it is, then the board's tokens are changed to reflect the move.

Parameters:
move - the desired move to execute.
Returns:
true if move is successful, false otherwise.

makeMove

public boolean makeMove(Move move)
Executes the given move on the board.

Checks to see if the Move is valid by calling isValidMove(konaneCommon.Move). If it is, then the board's tokens are changed to reflect the move. Decodes move and calls the previous version of makeMove(int, int, int, int, byte).

Parameters:
move - the desired move to execute.
Returns:
true if move is successful, false otherwise.

removeInitialTokens

public int[] removeInitialTokens()
Removes two tokens from the center of a gameboard at the beginning of a game.

The two tokens are chosen by selecting the middle row of the board and the two middle columns, as calculated below:
middle_row = (height - 1) / 2
middle_column_1 = (height - 1) / 2
middle_column_2 = middle_column_1 + 1

Returns:
an array of integers representing the positions of the removed tokens. The array is of the form [column of first token, row of both tokens].

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a grid of ASCII characters representing the current state of the board. One row is printed per line with the columns separated by spaces. 'W' represents a white token, 'B' represents a black token, and '_' represents a blanks space.
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a String representation of the board.
See Also:
Konane.WHITE, Konane.BLACK, Konane.NONE
